init.title: HBX Controls Options
init.description: Update your SensorLinx credentials or polling interval.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to fetch data from SensorLinx. Default is 300 seconds (5 minutes). Minimum 60, maximum 3600.

hot_tank_outdoor_reset.name: Hot Tank Outdoor Reset
hot_tank_outdoor_reset.description: Enable Outdoor Reset for the hot tank. When enabled, the Tank Temperature setting will be replaced by Min Tank and Max Tank Temperature settings, allowing the target to adjust based on outdoor temperature.

cold_tank_outdoor_reset.name: Cold Tank Outdoor Reset
cold_tank_outdoor_reset.description: Enable Outdoor Reset for the cold tank. When enabled, the Tank Temperature setting will be replaced by Min Tank and Max Tank Temperature settings, allowing the target to adjust based on outdoor temperature.

permanent_heat_demand.name: Permanent Heat Demand
permanent_heat_demand.description: Force the system into permanent heating mode. When enabled, the system will continuously call for heat regardless of temperature setpoints.

permanent_cool_demand.name: Permanent Cool Demand
permanent_cool_demand.description: Force the system into permanent cooling mode. When enabled, the system will continuously call for cooling regardless of temperature setpoints.

warm_weather_shutdown.name: Warm Weather Shutdown
warm_weather_shutdown.description: Enable Warm Weather Shutdown (WWSD). When enabled, if the outdoor temperature rises above the configured threshold, the system (heat pumps and backup boiler) will be shut off.

cold_weather_shutdown.name: Cold Weather Shutdown
cold_weather_shutdown.description: Enable Cold Weather Shutdown (CWSD). When enabled, if the outdoor temperature drops below the configured threshold, the heat pumps will be shut off.

rotate_cycles.name: Rotate by Cycles
rotate_cycles.description: Enable heat pump rotation based on cycles. One cycle is defined as the heat pump turning on and then off. When enabled, heat pumps will rotate after the configured number of cycles.

rotate_time.name: Rotate by Time
rotate_time.description: Enable heat pump rotation based on run time. When enabled, heat pumps will rotate when the first heat pump exceeds the second by the configured number of hours of run time.

synchronized_stage_off.name: Synchronized Stage Off
synchronized_stage_off.description: Enable synchronized stage off (Off Staging). When OFF, heat pumps will stage off normally based on tank temperature, differential settings, or Stage OFF Lagtime settings. When ON, all heat pumps will stage off at the same time.

backup_lag_time.name: Backup Lag Time
backup_lag_time.description: Enable backup lag time. When enabled, a minimum delay (in minutes) is required between heat pump stages and the backup boiler turning on.

backup_differential.name: Backup Differential
backup_differential.description: Enable backup differential. When enabled, the backup will come on instantaneously if the tank temperature drops to or below the target minus the differential (overriding backup lag time settings).

backup_only_outdoor_temp.name: Backup Only Outdoor Temp
backup_only_outdoor_temp.description: Enable Backup Only mode based on outdoor temperature. When enabled, if the outdoor temperature is below the configured threshold, only the backup will run for heating calls (heat pumps disabled).

backup_temp.name: Backup Temperature
backup_temp.description: Enable backup temperature threshold. When enabled, if the outdoor temperature falls below the configured value, the backup will be allowed to come on.

wide_priority_differential.name: Wide Priority Differential
wide_priority_differential.description: When enabled, the tank target will exceed the setpoint by the configured differential before switching between heat and cool demands if both are present. When disabled, the tank target switches as soon as the setpoint is satisfied. This should not be used for single tank systems.

two_stage_heat_pump.name: Two Stage Heat Pump
two_stage_heat_pump.description: Enable this when using dual stage heat pumps or pumps with 2 compressors per unit. This setting only appears when the Number of Stages is set to an even value (2 or 4).

backup_only_tank_temp.name: Backup Only Tank Temp
backup_only_tank_temp.description: When enabled, if the tank temperature exceeds the configured threshold, only the backup will heat the tank to the target temperature (heat pumps disabled). This should be set lower than the hot tank target temperature.

hvac_mode_priority.name: HVAC Mode Priority
hvac_mode_priority.description: Sets the HVAC mode priority for the device. Heat: prioritize heating. Cool: prioritize cooling. Auto: automatically switch based on demand.

hot_tank_target_temperature.name: Hot Tank Target Temperature
hot_tank_target_temperature.description: The target temperature for the hot tank. This is the desired temperature the system will try to maintain.

hot_tank_min_temperature.name: Hot Tank Min Temperature
hot_tank_min_temperature.description: The minimum tank temperature for the hot tank (bottom of the heat curve). The target will approach this temperature as the outdoor temperature approaches the Warm Weather Shutdown threshold. Only used when Outdoor Reset is enabled.

hot_tank_max_temperature.name: Hot Tank Max Temperature
hot_tank_max_temperature.description: The maximum tank temperature for the hot tank (top of the heat curve). The target will approach this temperature as the outdoor temperature approaches the Design Outdoor Temperature. Only used when Outdoor Reset is enabled.

hot_tank_outdoor_reset.name: Hot Tank Design Outdoor Temp
hot_tank_outdoor_reset.description: The Design Outdoor Temperature for the hot tank outdoor reset calculation. This is the coldest expected outdoor temperature used to calculate the heat curve. Range: -40°F to 127°F.

cold_tank_target_temperature.name: Cold Tank Target Temperature
cold_tank_target_temperature.description: The target temperature for the cold tank. This is the desired temperature the system will try to maintain.

cold_tank_min_temperature.name: Cold Tank Min Temperature
cold_tank_min_temperature.description: The minimum tank temperature for the cold tank (bottom of the cooling curve). The target will approach this temperature as the outdoor temperature approaches the Outdoor Design Temperature. Only used when Outdoor Reset is enabled.

cold_tank_max_temperature.name: Cold Tank Max Temperature
cold_tank_max_temperature.description: The maximum tank temperature for the cold tank (top of the cooling curve). The target will approach this temperature as the outdoor temperature approaches the Cold Weather Shutdown threshold. Only used when Outdoor Reset is enabled.

cold_tank_outdoor_reset.name: Cold Tank Design Outdoor Temp
cold_tank_outdoor_reset.description: The Design Outdoor Temperature for the cold tank outdoor reset calculation. This is the hottest expected outdoor temperature used to calculate the cooling curve. Range: 0°F to 119°F.

warm_weather_shutdown.name: Warm Weather Shutdown Temp
warm_weather_shutdown.description: The outdoor temperature threshold for Warm Weather Shutdown (WWSD). If the outdoor temperature rises above this value, the system (heat pumps and backup boiler) will be shut off. Range: 34°F to 180°F.

cold_weather_shutdown.name: Cold Weather Shutdown Temp
cold_weather_shutdown.description: The outdoor temperature threshold for Cold Weather Shutdown (CWSD). If the outdoor temperature drops below this value, the heat pumps will be shut off. Range: 33°F to 119°F.

stage_on_lag_time.name: Stage ON Lag Time
stage_on_lag_time.description: The minimum lag time (in minutes) between heat pump stages turning on. Even if the differential has been exceeded, this time must elapse before the next stage can turn on. Range: 1 to 240 minutes.

stage_off_lag_time.name: Stage OFF Lag Time
stage_off_lag_time.description: The minimum lag time (in seconds) between heat pump stages turning off. Range: 1 to 240 seconds.

rotate_cycles.name: Rotate Cycles
rotate_cycles.description: The number of cycles at which to rotate the heat pumps. One cycle is defined as the heat pump turning on and then off. Range: 1 to 240 cycles.

rotate_time.name: Rotate Time
rotate_time.description: The time of rotation between heat pumps (in hours of run time). Heat pumps will rotate when the first heat pump exceeds the second by this amount. Range: 1 to 240 hours.

backup_lag_time.name: Backup Lag Time
backup_lag_time.description: The minimum lag time (in minutes) between heat pump stages and the backup boiler turning on. Range: 1 to 240 minutes.

backup_differential.name: Backup Differential
backup_differential.description: The temperature differential at which the backup will come on instantly. This overrides backup lag time settings. Example: With a tank target of 115°F and backup differential of 10°F, backup turns on at 105°F (if all heat pumps are already on). Range: 2°F to 100°F.

hot_tank_differential.name: Hot Tank Differential
hot_tank_differential.description: The temperature differential for the hot tank. For example, a differential of 4°F allows for 2 degrees above and 2 degrees below the target temperature before a demand is present. Range: 2°F to 100°F.

cold_tank_differential.name: Cold Tank Differential
cold_tank_differential.description: The temperature differential for the cold tank. For example, a differential of 4°F allows for 2 degrees above and 2 degrees below the target temperature before a demand is present. Range: 2°F to 100°F.

backup_only_outdoor_temp.name: Backup Only Outdoor Temp
backup_only_outdoor_temp.description: The outdoor temperature threshold below which only the backup will run for heating calls. Heat pumps will not run until the outdoor temperature rises above this setting. Range: 2°F to 100°F.

number_of_stages.name: Number of Stages
number_of_stages.description: The number of heat pump stages attached to the control. If Backup is being used, maximum is 3 stages. With 4 stages and Backup enabled, Pump Output 1 will be used for Backup. Range: 1 to 4.

backup_temp.name: Backup Temperature
backup_temp.description: The outdoor temperature threshold below which the backup will be allowed to come on. Range: 2°F to 100°F.

weather_shutdown_lag_time.name: Weather Shutdown Lag Time
weather_shutdown_lag_time.description: The lag time (in hours) for Warm Weather Shutdown (WWSD) or Cold Weather Shutdown (CWSD). This is how long to wait after the outdoor temperature threshold is met before entering shutdown mode. Range: 0 to 240 hours.

heat_cool_switch_delay.name: Heat/Cool Switch Delay
heat_cool_switch_delay.description: The delay (in seconds) between switching from heat to cool mode and vice versa. This prevents rapid cycling between heating and cooling. Range: 30 to 600 seconds.

backup_only_tank_temp.name: Backup Only Tank Temp
backup_only_tank_temp.description: The tank temperature threshold above which only the backup will heat the tank (heat pumps disabled). This should be set lower than the hot tank target temperature. Range: 33°F to 200°F.
